sub_title: GCC based Ex Banker turned intrapreneur, operator, angel investor & startup mentor.
summary:
An ex banking & financial services professional turned intrapreneur & angel investor with over 21 years experience.

Over 16 years in GCC across private banking, investments, trading, contracting, fintech, web3.0 & SaaS startups.

Ex Citi Bank & Citi Financial, Ex ICICI Bank & Ex Maruti Insurance with stints in India and Middle East ( UAE, Kuwait, Qatar & Oman).

Presently leading a dynamic team at Singularis Ventures, an enterprise creating an ecosystem in the future world of work. 

I also serve as a Venture Partner- Middle East with Bharat Innovation Fund.  Bharat Innovation Fund is backing breakthrough innovations from India & is built upon a decade of early investing and startup support experience at CIIE.CO & is a part of CIIE.CO's innovation continuum and operate as an autonomous and focussed initiative - guided by our Board and Investment Team. 

Past Roles & Experience:

Chief Business Officer TransFi- Part of a world class team of crypto natives, payments experts and engineering leaders at Trans-Fi, on a mission to make crypto accessible to a billion users. TransFi is building crypto onramp & offramp solutions with an easy-to-use wallet offering with a great UX at low costs. 

COO CEMEA & Head Strategic Partnerships, Goals101 : A transaction behaviour intelligence company- Managed multiple roles across GCC & India including relationship management/business development with banks & payment networks in UAE, Qatar, Kuwait & KSA. Led strategic partnerships with Fintech, Consulting & Tech companies in India. Led Series B plus fund raise discussions with investment banks, global VC’s, corporate investors and family offices.

General manager, AEM Group, Qatar- Managed a group of companies owned by members of Qatar Royal family. Complete P&L responsibility for the entities in industrial products distribution, trading & contracting domain. Restructured the group operations, implemented growth strategies and added multiple global partners from US, Europe, Middle East, India & China including Sinicon UK, ABB, Techniche International/Techniche Europe, PRD Rigs, Rapid EPS, TSS, Josam & Parex.

General Secretary, Vice President & Board member at IBPC Qatar ( Indian Business & Professional Council) over a term of four years, under the aegis of Embassy of India in Qatar. Worked closely with the Ambassadors & commercial & economic team at the embassy to promote trade, commerce & investments between India & Qatar. 

Part of the founding team at Indian Business & Professional Council LLC(G) at Qatar Financial Centre.

[{'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'role': 'General Secretary', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'IBPC Qatar', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFbm2i3vFHW8g/company-logo_400_400/0/1519881035745?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=84gxybcgYS8ZIkF0MY6ZfsyTdm--6I0hwgEPszzhsNw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ibpn-qatar/'}, 'cause': 'ECONOMIC_EMPOWERMENT', 'description': 'The Indian Business & Professional Council, Doha / Qatar is a professional organization of senior Indian expatriates formally launched on the 16th February 1999 under the aegis of the Embassy of India, Doha with Ambassador of India to Qatar as its Patron.

The Indian Business & Professional Council (IBPC) aims to provide a forum for the promotion of trade and commerce and manufacturing & trading joint ventures between Indian and Qatar in addition to promoting investment in either country on a bilateral basis.

The IBPC acts as an informal interface in introducing Indian Companies to the vast opportunities that exist in the industrial scenario in Qatar and aids them in projecting their expertise and strengths in various disciplines for prospective alliances with business & trade organizations operating in Qatar.
It also aims to provide a reciprocal interface for business and trade organizations established in Qatar to explore business opportunities in India.

http://indianembassyqatar.gov.in/pages/ibpn.php

http://www.ibpcqatar.com 
'}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'role': 'Member', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Parents Committee - The Cambridge School Qatar', 'logo': None, 'url': None}, 'cause': 'CHILDREN', 'description': None}, {'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2019}, 'end': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2020}}, 'role': 'Vice President & Management Committee Member ', 'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'IBPC Qatar', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C510BAQFbm2i3vFHW8g/company-logo_400_400/0/1519881035745?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=84gxybcgYS8ZIkF0MY6ZfsyTdm--6I0hwgEPszzhsNw', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ibpn-qatar/'}, 'cause': 'ECONOMIC_EMPOWERMENT', 'description': 'The Indian Business & Professional Council-IBPC Qatar is an apex body of Indian Businessmen & Professionals formally launched on the 16th February 1999 under the aegis of the Embassy of India, Doha with Ambassador of India to Qatar as its Patron. IBPC is currently registered as a business council with Qatar Financial Centre and established as IBPC LLC (G) in its current corporate structure. 

The Indian Business & Professional Council (IBPC) aims to provide a forum for the promotion of trade,commerce, manufacturing & trading joint ventures between Indian and Qatar,in addition to promoting investment in either country on a bilateral basis.

The IBPC acts as an informal interface in introducing Indian Companies to the vast opportunities that exist in the industrial scenario in Qatar and aids them in projecting their expertise and strengths in various disciplines for prospective alliances with business & trade organizations operating in Qatar.
It also aims to provide a reciprocal interface for business and trade organizations established in Qatar to explore business opportunities in India.

http://indianembassyqatar.gov.in/pages/ibpn.php

http://www.ibpcqatar.com 
'}]
